file_content.text: It was a pleasure working with you.
You don't have to tell me--I heard the name loud and clear, though I sorely wish I hadn't: Esorr Kayin.
Kayin's master is a Dark Council member... I'd be a fool to oppose him.
But anyway, your trial here is done. I will send my commendations to Overseer Harkun. You may return to him now.
No more torture? But I was just getting started.
Done so soon?
What? No more torture? Oh, but I was just getting started.
Done so soon?
I know, I know--it's so hard to stop once you've started. Perhaps later, if you survive your trials.
It has been most pleasant watching you work, acolyte. Truly, I wish you the best of luck in your remaining trials.
What are you going to do about the murderer?
What are you going to do?
Nothing--although the apprentice's master will have to be informed.
It's not my business to dispense justice, certainly not where the Dark Council is concerned.
You're a coward, inquisitor.
You call yourself Sith?
I am a living Sith. I intend to remain that way.
If you don't make sure justice is served, Alif will die.
Protect him.
Okay. I understand.
I'm glad you think so.
That acolyte is going to need protection.
What about Alif?
Concern for matters that are not your business is a weakness that will get you killed.
I suggest you eliminate this undesirable trait as quickly as possible and forget about this acolyte.
So you're just going to let yourself be bullied.
You're weak.
And what would you suggest? I don't have the power to oppose a Dark Council member, and neither do you.
Still, there has to be something you can do.
I don't believe that.
You are persistent, aren't you?
You're a coward.
Well, I suppose it wouldn't hurt to keep him here while the master of the murdered apprentice pursues justice.
Perhaps they can be made to believe that the acolyte hasn't been broken yet.
Oh, all right.
Can't you get him off-planet or get some guards or something? He's as good as dead here.
Isn't there anything else?
Getting him off-planet is no simple matter, but there is a Darth on Dromund Kaas who owes me a favor.
I'll make sure she takes this fool as her apprentice. He'll be out of Kayin's reach, but from there he's on his own.
I don't care what you do, just do it.
As long as he's safe.
Fair enough. I'll requisition some guards to protect him.
You have a most unusual approach, acolyte. Watch it doesn't get you into trouble.
Do I have to force you to help?
Protect him or else.
You are a mere fledgling, acolyte. Don't think you can scare me. Now, if you'll excuse me.
I have more important things to do than argue with a slave.
You have to protect him. He doesn't stand a chance without your help.
But he'll die.
I suppose.
Trust me, acolyte. I have far more experience with these things than you have.
Find out who murdered the apprentice.
Acolyte! You've arrived and not a moment too soon.
Harkun has informed me of your situation, and I have a very special task prepared for you indeed.
I am a very special Sith.
Makes sense.
We'll see about that, won't we?
I hope I can live up to the challenge.
I hope I'm worthy.
Only that you were pulled from the muck, as it were, and that your wretched existence is not likely to last much longer.
Let's get this over with.
Hmm. Perhaps you do not have as much to unlearn as Harkun believes.
Harkun has given me very specific instructions. You were raised as a slave but must discard those traits and learn to control others.
And I have just the task for that end. Meet this driveling excuse for an acolyte. He will be your victim.
Victim, huh? This sounds like it could be fun.
Excellent.
This is not an idle diversion, acolyte.
Victim? I don't much like the sound of that.
That seems wrong.
I don't much like the sound of "victim."
That seems wrong.
I personally prefer the word "subject" myself, but most people can only comprehend my work in crass terms.
What's going on?
The art of interrogation--the inquisitor's art--is a delicate one. It is the art of manipulation, of pain, of control.
I need you to extract information from this "subject" using whatever means you desire.
What do you need me to learn?
And the lesson is?
I have no stomach for torture.
I don't like it.
It matters not to me--though if that's the case, you may not have the stomach for being Sith.
I can get behind this.
Then I'll enjoy watching you work.
A short while ago, there was what we call an "unauthorized murder" here in the Academy. A rivalry among apprentices resulted in death.
Normally when there's no obvious culprit, as in this case, we let these things slide. But the murdered apprentice's master has demanded otherwise.
And you want me to find out who the murderer is.
So I find the killer.
You want me to find out who the murderer is.
So I find the killer.
Indeed.
What makes this apprentice's master so special?
Why the privileges?
He's a very powerful Darth and a favorite of the Dark Council, the Sith's governing body.
You think this pathetic lump of flesh did it?
You want him to confess?
No, he hasn't even passed his trials. Clearly he's not capable of any such thing.
This fool made the mistake of bragging too loudly that he had witnessed the murder taking place.
Interrogate him. Make him tell you who committed this crime, at any cost.
No problem.
Excellent. Get to it then. I look forward to watching you work.
I'll see what I can do, but I won't torture anyone.
There must be a better way.
Already you are a disappointment to me, acolyte. But Harkun said nothing of torture being a requirement, so I will not restrict you.
Cover your ears--this may get a little loud.
I'm going to enjoy this.
Thank you for the warning, but I prefer to cherish every scream.
I have no business with you.
